intro: Gilia micromeria, commonly known as the narrowleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The flowers are typically blue to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
